name: Karma
title: The Enlightened One

P.name: Gathering Fire

effects.description: Innate: Mantra's current cooldown is reduced by 4 seconds for each enemy champion hit by Karma's damaging abilities.

P.notes:
Inner Flame /  Soulflare reduces  Mantra's cooldown per champion hit by either damage instance (up to a maximum total reduction of 40 seconds if 5 enemy champions are hit by both instances of damage).
 Focused Resolve /  Renewal reduces  Mantra's cooldown when initially cast and again after the duration for the tether has expired (for a total reduction of 8 seconds).
P.blurb: Innate:  Mantra's current cooldown is  reduced by a few seconds for each enemy champion hit by  Karma's damaging  abilities.

Q.name: Inner Flame

effects.description: Active: Karma fires a bolt in the target direction that explodes on the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and slowing them by 40% for 1.5 seconds.

Q.notes:
Spell shield will block the initial impact from Inner Flame.
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
Inner Flame's effect radius is centered around the location of the missile as it collides.
Q.blurb: Active:  Karma fires a bolt in the target direction that explodes on the first enemy hit, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies and briefly  slowing them.

Q.name: Soulflare

effects.description: Mantra Bonus: Inner Flame deals increased damage, and fires a larger bolt that also explodes at maximum range.
The explosion creates a field for 1.5 seconds that slows enemies within by 50%, which then ruptures to deal magic damage.

Q.notes:
Spell shield will block the initial impact from either ability but will not block Soulflare's field damage.
Soulflare's detonation radius is centered around the location of the missile as it collides, while the lingering field will always be created at the impacted enemy's center instead.
Soulflare will cast from wherever Karma is at the end of the cast time.
Q.blurb: Mantra Bonus: Inner Flame deals increased damage, and fires a larger bolt that also explodes at max range.

W.name: Focused Resolve

effects.description: Active: Karma deals magic damage to the target enemy champion, monster or pet and forms a tether between her and them for 2 seconds, during which they are revealed.
If the tether is not broken by the end of its duration, the target is dealt the same magic damage again and is rooted for a duration, during which they are revealed.

W.notes:
Spell shield will block the tether's application and damage but not the aftereffects of one already applied.
If Karma is  tethered to multiple targets, the visual effects of all tethers will disappear at the end of the first tether's duration, but the other targets will remain tethered.(bug)
If the target becomes  untargetable,  dies, or is no longer in  sight during the cast time, this ability will cancel but does not go on  cooldown nor pay its cost.
If they move too far away during the cast time, however, the ability will cancel as normal but still go on cooldown and pay its cost.(bug)
 Summon Aery will still count as the target being damaged this way.(note)
W.blurb: Active:  Karma deals magic damage and  tethers to the target enemy  champion,  monster or  pet.

W.name: Renewal

effects.description: Mantra Bonus: Focused Resolve's root duration is increased. Karma heals for 17% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of her missing health once on-cast, and again once the tether lasts its full duration or the target dies while tethered.

W.notes:
Spell shield will block the tether's application and damage but not the aftereffects of one already applied.
If Karma is  tethered to multiple targets, the visual effects of all tethers will disappear at the end of the first tether's duration, but the other targets will remain tethered.(bug)
On cast, Renewal is treated as 2 abilities for  Conqueror,  Electrocute and  Phase Rush, instead of 1.(bug)
If the target becomes  untargetable,  dies, or is no longer in  sight during the cast time, this ability will cancel but does not go on  cooldown nor pay its cost.
If they move too far away during the cast time, however, the ability will cancel as normal but still go on cooldown and pay its cost.(bug)
Karma is still healed on-cast.
 Summon Aery will still count as the target being damaged this way.(note)
W.blurb:
Mantra Bonus:
Focused Resolve's  root is increased.

E.name: Inspire

effects.description: Active: Karma grants a shield to herself or the target allied champion for 2.5 seconds as well as 40% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.

E.notes: Inspire has a  forgiveness radius of 175 units.
E.blurb: Active:  Karma applies a  shield on herself or the target allied champion for a short time, which briefly grants  bonus movement speed.

E.name: Defiance

effects.description: Mantra - Active: Inspire grants a bonus amount of shielding.Inspire spreads to surrounding allied champions, granting them a shield for 2.5 seconds and 15% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds.

E.notes: Defiance has a  forgiveness radius of 175 units.
E.blurb:
Mantra Bonus:
Inspire's shield is increased, and Inspire spreads to surrounding allied champions at reduced power.

R.name: Mantra

effects.description: Active: Karma empowers her next basic ability within 8 seconds for an additional effect. Mantra can be used while affected by cast-inhibiting crowd control.
Karma begins the game with one rank in Mantra. Her empowered abilities scale based on Mantra's rank.

R.blurb: Active:  Karma empowers her next ability within a period to apply an additional effect.

lore: No mortal exemplifies the spiritual traditions of Ionia more than Karma. She is the living embodiment of an ancient soul reincarnated countless times, carrying all her accumulated memories into each new life, and blessed with power that few can comprehend. She has done her best to guide her people in recent times of crisis, though she knows that peace and harmony may come only at a considerable cost—both to her, and to the land she holds most dear.

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: No mortal exemplifies the spiritual traditions of Ionia more than Karma. She is the living embodiment of an ancient soul reincarnated countless times, carrying all her accumulated memories into each new life, and blessed with power that few can comprehend. She has done her best to guide her people in recent times of crisis, though she knows that peace and harmony may come only at a considerable cost—both to her, and to the land she holds most dear.

skins.name: Sun Goddess
skins.lore: An ageless being in whom the sun rises and sets, Karma is the key to an ancient prophecy spelling doom for the world. When she is overtaken by the moon, four titans will rise up from the depths of the earth, annihilating all life.

skins.name: Traditional
skins.lore: Created to capture the original feel of Karma, one of our first fully reworked champions.

skins.name: Warden
skins.lore: The Protectorate was an order dedicated to enforcing a rigid, unforgiving system of laws, in an attempt to slow the seemingly inevitable rise of the Magelords. Though the order itself was disbanded long ago, Wardens such as Karma still uphold its tenets… and guard its many secrets.

skins.name: Winter Wonder
skins.lore: A powerful sorceress at one with the natural world, Karma spreads snow like a soft blanket across the enchanted forests of the Winterlands. A loyal friend of the Poro King—wherever Karma goes, winter follows.

skins.name: Conqueror

descriptions.description: Loot exclusive gained during the 2019 MSI Event.

skins.lore: Commemorating the 2017 Mid-Season Invitational in Brazil.

skins.name: Dark Star

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2019.

skins.lore: Karma was a galaxy-spanning civilization dedicated to pacifism and personal enlightenment, unceremoniously erased from reality and reborn as a star-consuming horror. Devouring entire galactic systems, she enforces a dread order upon the cosmos, meditating in the vast oceans of emptiness where once there were stars.

skins.name: Dawnbringer

descriptions.description: This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.
This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.
This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.
This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.
This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.
This chroma was acquired during the 2019 Night & Dawn event. All proceeds went to charity.

skins.lore: Charged with governing the cosmic cycles of death and rebirth, Karma fights to protect the wellspring of souls as they journey to reincarnation. More so than the other cosmic beings, she cares for the mortal souls she shepherds, striving to create a more structured world.

skins.name: Odyssey

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2020 Worlds event.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: A High Priestess of the Templar Order, Karma has hired a group of offworld mercenaries to free a number of captured templars from the grip of Aatrox, an infamous and powerful crime lord. She has taken a more interventionist stance towards the rest of the universe following the loss and transformation of her former lover, Zed.

skins.name: Ruined

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2021 Sentinels event.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2021.

skins.lore: Surviving the initial ruination of Ionia, Karma is ultimately lost during a second one led by Viego himself. With the Spirit of Ionia itself removed from the continent, the Ionian people must band together to save one another, even as Karma twists the souls of millions to a new, horrific purpose.

skins.name: Tranquility Dragon

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the Worlds 2021 event.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2021.

skins.lore: As Brand's corruption spread, Karma sought the power to restore peace. When her desperate search throughout the land failed, Karma was left with nowhere left to look but within. After months of quiet contemplation, the fabled Tranquility Dragon greeted her in a vision. She awoke with the dragon's gift, the power to bring tranquil peace to face Brand's raging violence.

skins.name: Faerie Queen

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2023.
This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2023 Faerie Court event.

skins.lore: All hail Her Majesty, Karma, Queen of the Seelie Court of Light and Beauty! Though her selection and subsequent rise to the throne was a surprise to everyone (nobles, laymen, even Karma herself), she is a beacon of poise and power, overseeing the turning of seasons and keeping the balance between the ever-bickering seasonal sub-courts. Long live the Queen!

skins.name: Infernal

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2024.

skins.lore: Possessed by a spirit of the Infernal flame, Karma was once a powerful pyromancer of the Shadowfire Temple. Believing it possible to control the flame spirit, she captured it hoping to put an end to the Ashen Lord's reign but succumbed to the hellfire like all the rest.

skins.name: Spirit Blossom

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2025.

skins.lore: Long ago, the First Spirit of the Lands shaped two sisters—born together, yet bound by different fates. For a time, she watched over them, but when her gaze turned elsewhere, one strayed, creating twisted life in monstrous masks. Faced with the cost of her neglect, the First Spirit vowed never to turn away again, binding herself to endless rebirth.
